channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Binance lawsuit: 61 cryptocurrencies are now seen as securities by the SEC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: With its latest suit against Binance, the U.S. SEC has now labeled at least 61 cryptocurrencies as securities, affecting $100 billion worth of tokens on the market.

item.title: Apple's Vision Pro headset reveal swaps metaverse for 'spatial computing'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The tech giant finally dropped details of its new pricey mixed-reality headset during the Worldwide Developers Conference, though it made no mention of the word "metaverse."

item.title: Ex-NFL team owner Reggie Fowler gets 6 years for crypto ‘shadow banking’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: U.S. Attorney Damian Williams said Fowler’s lies exposed the U.S. financial system to “serious risk.”

item.title: SEC complaint hints at why Brian Brooks resigned as Binance.US CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: New details revealed in the SEC complaint could explain why Brian Brooks abruptly stepped down as CEO of Binance.US in 2021, a crypto lawyer suggests.

item.title: SEC’s Binance suit contains heavy mix of predictable charges, novel revelations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange has been hit with an SEC suit that many saw coming, but the details will be studied closely.

item.title: Binance was wrong to boot Monero, ZCash and other privacy coins
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By J.W. Verret
item.description: Binance betrayed our interests with its decision to delist privacy coins. In the long run, it may mean that users leave Binance in the dust.

item.title: Maybe Bitcoin didn’t bottom? SEC lawsuit against Binance shakes BTC bulls’ confidence
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Bitcoin’s price dropped to $25,500 after the SEC announced a lawsuit against Binance and Changpeng Zhao, a move which also has BTC bulls wondering if the bottom is truly in.

item.title: How regulators are mitigating the risk of extinction from AI: Law Decoded, May 29–June 5
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: There is no shortage of regulatory efforts to mitigate the negative impacts of artificial intelligence.

item.title: Price analysis 6/5: SPX, DXY, BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, DOGE, SOL, MATIC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin and several altcoins took a beating on reports that the SEC filed a suit against Binance in U.S. district court.

item.title: Tether invests in El Salvador’s $1B renewable energy project
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: El Salvador’s plans to build a billion dollar renewable energy precinct has found a first-round investor in stablecoin issuer Tether.

item.title: Blue chip collaterals help stabilize NFT lending: Paraspace
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: "We only support blue chip NFTs to reduce the risks," said Paraspace developers.

item.title: Why is the crypto market down today?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: The crypto market is down today after the news of the SEC suing Binance and its CEO Changpeng Zhao scares off investors.

item.title: AI-related crypto returns rose up to 41% after ChatGPT launched: Study
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: Researchers in Germany found that the launch of ChatGPT had a significant impact on AI-related cryptocurrencies, despite an overall bear market.

item.title: Fines and regulation: The ever-growing landscape of crypto compliance
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph Research
item.description: How have the regulatory and legal frameworks governing cryptocurrency fines transformed over the years, and what are the key trends and challenges?

item.title: GameStop NFT back in the spotlight after partnership with Illuvium
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The partnership will debut 20,000 nonfungible tokens in its inaugural collection.

item.title: SEC sues Binance in US district court for unregistered securities operations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: According to the regulator, Binance failed to register as a securities exchange and operated illegally in the United States.

item.title: Bitcoin price will get ‘another test’ of 200-week trend line — analyst
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: A crucial BTC price support level is coming back into the picture with Bitcoin bulls struggling below $27,000.

item.title: Hong Kong’s regulatory lead sets it up to be major crypto hub
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Hong Kong is increasingly solidifying its status as a crypto hub in Asia despite most other countries taking a cautious approach.

item.title: Consumer loyalty is waning: Web3 could bring it back
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Betsy Proctor
item.description: Understanding and nurturing fan loyalty may be even more essential in the sporting world than in most industries.

item.title: Are Web3 apps under scrutiny?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ilias Salvatore
item.description: One of the biggest challenges Web3 apps are facing is the difficulty of reaching a wider audience.

item.title: DeFi aggregation: Paving the way for mass adoption
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Wolfgang Rückerl
item.description: The DeFi revolution is transforming our financial landscape and empowering everyday people to take back control over their assets.

item.title: EU officials want all AI-generated content to be labeled
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: European Commission Vice President, Vera Jourova, said that companies deploying generative AI tools with the potential to spread disinformation should be publicly labeled.

item.title: The blockchain and AI bond, explained
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Nikolai Kuznetsov
item.description: Discover the potential of combining blockchain and AI for enhanced transparency, privacy, collaboration and innovation in various industries.

item.title: JPMorgan uses blockchain for 24/7 dollar transfers with Indian banks
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: JPMorgan applies blockchain to interbank U.S. dollar transactions in India amid growing signs of global de-dollarization.

item.title: ‘Crypto Tsar’ needed to ensure coordinated approach in the UK: EU lawmakers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: APPG chair Lisa Cameron emphasized the report’s significance in securing the U.K.’s leadership in the crypto sector and safeguarding consumers.

item.title: Ethereum gas fees cool down after May memecoin frenzy
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Besides Ethereum, Bitcoin’s meme frenzy via Ordinals has steeply declined from its high in May.

item.title: ‘$31K was not the end’ — 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin analysts are gearing up for a break toward the $30,000 mark, but what will BTC price action offer in the coming days?

item.title: Do Kwon out on bail once again after court dismisses prosecution appeal
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: The Terraform Labs co-founder is out on bail after a successful appeal in Montenegro but will be closely monitored until his next court appearance.

item.title: Atomic Wallet says hack affected 1% of active users, but investors claim otherwise
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: In the aftermath of the attack, Atomic Wallet — along with individual blockchain investigators — have amped up efforts to track and revert stolen funds.

item.title: Bitcoin Ordinals rolls out upgrade to rectify 'Cursed Inscriptions' issue
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Previously unrecognized Ordinals inscriptions will be indexed by the protocol following the upgrade, which will allow them to be traded.
